card.name: Abyssal Specter
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
card.flavor: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.

card.name: Air Elemental
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Pray that it doesn't seek the safety of your lungs.

card.name: Aladdin's Ring
card.ability: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"A good lamp will light your way. A good ring will clear it."
—Nervan, royal jeweler

card.name: Ambition's Cost
card.ability: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
card.flavor: "Knowledge demands sacrifice."

card.name: Anaba Shaman
card.ability: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Just try taking this bull by the horns.

card.name: Angel of Mercy
card.ability:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor: A song of life soars over fields of blood.

card.name: Angelic Page
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: If only every message were as perfect as its bearer.

card.name: Archivist
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Words—so innocent and powerless are they, as standing in a dictionary; how potent for good and evil they become to one who knows how to combine them"
—Nathaniel Hawthorne

card.name: Ardent Militia
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor: Knights fight for honor and mercenaries fight for gold. The militia fights for hearth and home.

card.name: Avatar of Hope
card.ability:
If you have 3 or less life, Avatar of Hope costs {6} less to cast.
Flying
Avatar of Hope can block any number of creatures.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The converted mana cost of this card is still 8, even if you only pay {W}{W} to cast it.

card.name: Aven Cloudchaser
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.

card.name: Aven Fisher
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Fisher dies, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: The same spears that catch their food today will defend their homes tomorrow.

card.name: Aven Flock
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{W}: Aven Flock gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Just as each added feather steadies the wing, so does the flock grow stronger with each new member.

card.name: Balance of Power
card.ability: If target opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.
card.flavor:
"To empty your mind is to fill your grave."
—Lat-Nam teaching
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The number of cards is counted during resolution.

card.name: Balduvian Barbarians
card.flavor:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor,
To the canyons of Bandu,
We drink and fight and feast and die
As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

card.name: Beast of Burden
card.ability: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
card.flavor: The heavier the load, the harder it works.

card.name: Birds of Paradise
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Blanchwood Armor
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
card.flavor:
"There's never been a dwarven smith who could match the marvels that Gaea herself forges."
—Elvish champion

card.name: Blaze
card.ability: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Fire never dies alone.

card.name: Blessed Reversal
card.ability: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
card.flavor: Even an enemy is a valuable resource.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The creatures are counted on resolution.

card.name: Blinding Angel
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Blinding Angel deals combat damage to a player, that player skips his or her next combat phase.
card.flavor: "Their eyes will shrivel and blacken before faith's true light."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you are damaged by more than one, the effects are cumulative and you skip multiple combat phases.

card.name: Blood Moon
card.ability: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.
card.flavor: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : Non-basic lands that are turned into Mountains with Blood Moon are still non-basic. Blood Moon does nothing to change the land's Supertype.

card.name: Bloodshot Cyclops
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.
card.flavor: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.

card.name: Bog Imp
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.

card.name: Bog Wraith
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.

card.name: Boil
card.ability: Destroy all Islands.
card.flavor: "When every reef is bared and every wave is dust—only then shall I rest."

card.name: Boomerang
card.ability: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Returne from whence ye came. . . ."
—Edmund Spenser, The Faerie Queene

card.name: Brass Herald
card.ability:
As Brass Herald enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
When Brass Herald enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all creature cards of the chosen type revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Creatures of the chosen type get +1/+1.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You must choose a creature type that already exists in Magic.

card.name: Bribery
card.ability: Search target opponent's library for a creature card and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.flavor: In Mercadia City, loyalties extend only as far as your purse can stretch.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You put the creature onto the battlefield, so you control it and any "enters the battlefield" abilities it has.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Call of the Wild
card.ability: {2}{G}{G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
card.flavor: From a whisper to a roar, the call is heard by all and refused by none.

card.name: Canopy Spider
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: It keeps the upper reaches of the forest free of every menace . . . except for the spider itself.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Canyon Wildcat
card.ability: Mountainwalk
card.flavor: In the warrior kingdom of Keld, the cats used in the hunt are prized for their tracking sense and ability to climb walls.

card.name: Carrion Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Carrion Wall.
card.flavor: A wall built from the bodies of the enemy will never lack building material in times of war.

card.name: Catalog
card.ability: Draw two cards, then discard a card.
card.flavor:
Though those who study are as many as the hairs on an ox, those who succeed are as rare as unicorns' horns.
—Chinese proverb

card.name: Chastise
card.ability: Destroy target attacking creature. You gain life equal to its power.
card.flavor:
"Why do we pray to the Ancestor? Because She listens."
—Mystic elder

card.name: Choke
card.ability: Islands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
card.flavor:
"One day we shall walk where once was water."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

card.name: Cinder Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Cinder Wall blocks, destroy it at end of combat.
card.flavor:
"The smell of roasted flesh hung over the valley for hours."
—Onean sergeant

card.name: Circle of Protection: Black
card.ability: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
card.ability: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Green
card.ability: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Red
card.ability: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: White
card.ability: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
10/4/2004 : Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

card.name: City of Brass
card.ability:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The damaging ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

card.name: Coastal Hornclaw
card.ability: Sacrifice a land: Coastal Hornclaw gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Jamuraan farmers fear three things above all else: droughts, floods, and hornclaws.

card.name: Coastal Piracy
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: "I don't like to think of myself as a pirate. I'm more like a stimulator of the local economy."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You draw one card per creature, not one per point of damage.

card.name: Coastal Tower
card.ability:
Coastal Tower enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: A beacon in the night, a dream in the fog.

card.name: Coat of Arms
card.ability: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
card.flavor:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
10/4/2004 : If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
10/1/2009 : Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

card.name: Coercion
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor: "Human tenderness is simply weakness in a pretty package."

card.name: Collective Unconscious
card.ability: Draw a card for each creature you control.
card.flavor: "The beasts of the wild are my senses. It is through their eyes that all knowledge shall come to me."

card.name: Concentrate
card.ability: Draw three cards.
card.flavor: "The treasure in my mind is greater than any worldly glory."

card.name: Confiscate
card.ability:
Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)
You control enchanted permanent.
card.flavor:
"It is better to take what does not belong to you than to let it lie around neglected."
—Mark Twain, More Maxims of Mark
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you take control of an Aura, you do not get to move it.

card.name: Coral Eel
card.flavor: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

card.name: Cowardice
card.ability: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)
card.flavor:
"Cowards die many times before their deaths;
The valiant never taste of death but once."
—William Shakespeare, Julius Caesar

card.name: Craw Wurm
card.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

card.name: Creeping Mold
card.ability: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
card.flavor: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.

card.name: Crossbow Infantry
card.ability: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor:
"He can split a marshfly in two from halfway across the range."
—Onean sergeant

card.name: Crystal Rod
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Polished by a thousand waves.

card.name: Curiosity
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: "You know that secret? The one that wakes you up at night in a cold sweat? The one you think no one else in the world knows? Well, guess what."
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : You draw one card each time the enchanted creature damages the opponent. This is not one card per point of damage.
2/1/2007 : If put on your opponent's creature, you do not draw a card when that creature damages you. The creature has to damage your opponent in order to have this work.
2/1/2007 : Drawing a card is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later and do it, even if it is something you normally do.
9/22/2011 : "You" refers to the controller of Curiosity, which may be different from the controller of the enchanted creature."An opponent" refers to an opponent of Curiosity's controller.
9/22/2011 : Any damage dealt by the enchanted creature to an opponent will cause Curiosity to trigger, not just combat damage.
9/22/2011 : Curiosity doesn't trigger if the enchanted creature deals damage to a planeswalker controlled by an opponent.

card.name: Daring Apprentice
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
card.flavor: "I've seen my master do this a hundred times. How hard can it be?"

card.name: Dark Banishing
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Ha, banishment? Be merciful, say ‘death,'
For exile hath more terror in his look,
Much more than death."
—William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet

card.name: Death Pit Offering
card.ability:
When Death Pit Offering enters the battlefield, sacrifice all creatures you control.
Creatures you control get +2/+2.
card.flavor:
"Kill them all and feed them to the new recruits."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

card.name: Death Pits of Rath
card.ability: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Neither could I forget what I had read of these pits—that the sudden extinction of life formed no part of their most horrible plan."
—Edgar Allan Poe,
"The Pit and the Pendulum"

card.name: Deathgazer
card.ability: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
card.flavor: Your entire life passes before its eyes.

card.name: Deepwood Ghoul
card.ability: Pay 2 life: Regenerate Deepwood Ghoul.
card.flavor: They feed on the living to stay undead.

card.name: Defense Grid
card.ability: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.
card.flavor:
"A good deal of tyranny goes by the name of protection."
—Crystal Eastman,
"Equality or Protection"
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The additional cost can be reduced by effects that reduce costs, such as Sapphire Medallion.
5/1/2006 : In Two-Headed Giant, spells don’t cost extra on your own turn.

card.name: Deflection
card.ability: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
card.flavor: The golden rule of revenge: Do unto others what they tried to do unto you.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
10/4/2004 : This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
10/4/2004 : The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
10/4/2004 : You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.
10/4/2004 : You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
10/4/2004 : If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
10/4/2004 : This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
10/4/2004 : You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.
2/1/2009 : If a spell targets multiple things, you can't target it with Deflection, even if all but one of those targets has become illegal.
2/1/2009 : If a spell targets the same player or object multiple times, you can't target it with Deflection.

card.name: Dehydration
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
card.flavor:
"Cry to the sun and watch as even your tears forsake you."
—Acolyte of Marit Lage

card.name: Demolish
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or land.
card.flavor:
"Pound the steel until it fits.
Doesn't work? Bash to bits."
—Dwarven forging song

card.name: Demystify
card.ability: Destroy target enchantment.

card.name: Diabolic Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.

card.name: Dingus Egg
card.ability: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
card.flavor: Legend has it that the world was hatched from a dingus egg.

card.name: Disrupting Scepter
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.flavor: "True power is controlling not only the hearts of your subjects, but their minds as well."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can use it on yourself.

card.name: Distorting Lens
card.ability: {T}: Target permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The Eye altering alters all."
—William Blake, "The Mental Traveller"

card.name: Diving Griffin
card.ability: Flying, vigilance
card.flavor:
To outrace the griffin
—Kipamu expression meaning
"to do the impossible"

card.name: Drudge Skeletons
card.ability: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook

card.name: Dusk Imp
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: It despises humans and squirrels and beasts and dwarves and cephalids . . . well, it despises just about everything.

card.name: Dwarven Demolition Team
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target Wall.
card.flavor: Foolishly, Najib retreated to his castle at El-Abar; the next morning he was dead. In just one night, the dwarven forces had reduced the mighty walls to mere rubble.

card.name: Eastern Paladin
card.ability: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
card.flavor:
"There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."
—Southern paladin

card.name: Elfhame Palace
card.ability:
Elfhame Palace enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The elfhames are the closest thing to "civilization" the elves allow themselves.

card.name: Elite Archers
card.ability: {T}: Elite Archers deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: They fletch their arrows with the feathers of angels.

card.name: Elite Javelineer
card.ability: Whenever Elite Javelineer blocks, it deals 1 damage to target attacking creature.
card.flavor: "Precision is frequently more valuable than force."

card.name: Elvish Champion
card.ability: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
card.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
8/1/2005 : This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

card.name: Elvish Lyrist
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
card.flavor: Each pluck of the strings breaks the hold of the unnatural on the world.

card.name: Elvish Pioneer
card.ability: When Elvish Pioneer enters the battlefield, you may put a basic land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor: "Destruction is the work of an afternoon. Creation is the work of a lifetime."

card.name: Elvish Piper
card.ability: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching
card.ruling:
5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Elvish Scrapper
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Scrapper: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: "The stories tell of a distant time when machines overran the forests, destroying everything that lived. That time will not come again."

card.name: Emperor Crocodile
card.ability: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.
card.flavor: The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability will trigger if you don't control another creature, even for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability.
10/4/2004 : Only checks if you control no other creatures at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution, so gaining control of a creature before then will not save the Crocodile.

card.name: Enrage
card.ability: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "You wouldn't like me when I'm angry."

card.name: Ensnaring Bridge
card.ability: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.
card.flavor:
"Why build a bridge that needs to be guarded?"
—Elvish champion
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : All creatures on the battlefield (including yours) are subject to the restriction based on the number of cards in your hand.
10/4/2004 : It only checks the cards in your hand when declaring attackers. Once they are declared, changes to your hand size or to the power of the creatures will not remove creatures from the attack.

card.name: Evacuation
card.ability: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: Which is more unsettling: the roar of battle or the silence that follows?

card.name: Execute
card.ability:
Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch

card.name: Fallen Angel
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Why do you weep for the dead? I rejoice, for they have died for me."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can sacrifice itself.

card.name: Fear
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor:
"The horror The horror"
—Joseph Conrad, Heart of Darkness

card.name: Fecundity
card.ability: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller may draw a card.
card.flavor: Life is eternal. A lifetime is ephemeral.

card.name: Fertile Ground
card.ability:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
card.flavor:
"The love of nature . . . is a furious, burning, physical greed. . . ."
—Mary Webb, The House in Dormer Forest
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The color of mana to be generated is chosen when tapping the land for mana.

card.name: Fighting Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Scholars in their ivory towers call them "sharks of the sky." Scholars on the road don't call them at all.

card.name: Flash Counter
card.ability: Counter target instant spell.
card.flavor: "So much for that bright idea"

card.name: Flashfires
card.ability: Destroy all Plains.
card.flavor: Dry grass is tinder before the spark.

card.name: Fleeting Image
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow."
—Aesop, Fables, trans. Jacobs

card.name: Flight
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

card.name: Flying Carpet
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Woven from strands of griffin mane and pegasus tail.

card.name: Fodder Cannon
card.ability: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Fodder Cannon deals 4 damage to target creature.
card.flavor:
Step 1: Find your cousin.
Step 2: Get your cousin in the cannon.
Step 3: Find another cousin.

card.name: Foratog
card.ability: {G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Foratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Five hundred years to grow—barely a minute to eat.

card.name: Fugitive Wizard
card.flavor: The College of Lat-Nam is often forced to expel students whose experiments grow too risky or too cruel.

card.name: Fungusaur
card.ability: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: Rather than sheltering her young, the female fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If more than one creature damages it at one time, it only gets one counter.

card.name: Furnace of Rath
card.ability: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
card.flavor: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect. This means you can't normally end up with an odd amount of damage on something.
10/4/2004 : The trample rules cause damage to be divided before it is doubled.
10/4/2004 : If you have two of these on the battlefield, the damage is multiplied by 4.
10/4/2004 : The multiplied damage counts in all ways as if it came from the original source. Furnace of Rath is not the source.
8/1/2005 : If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt, the player who would be dealt damage or the controller of the creature that would be dealt damage chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, "Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn." Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to a player who has cast Mending Hands targeting himself or herself. That player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Furnace of Rath double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.

card.name: Fyndhorn Elder
card.ability: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "It is useful to be able to speak to the trees. But it is truly wondrous to be able to listen to them."

card.name: Gaea's Herald
card.ability: Creature spells can't be countered.
card.flavor: The elves' battle cries cut paths through the Æther, guiding those who would stand in Gaea's defense.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability applies to your opponent's spells as well as your own.

card.name: Giant Badger
card.ability: Whenever Giant Badger blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Disturb a sleeping badger and the snapping of your bones will awaken the countryside.

card.name: Giant Cockroach
card.flavor: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.

card.name: Giant Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Giant Spider
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor:
Watching the spider's web
—Llanowar expression meaning
"focusing on the wrong thing"
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Glorious Anthem
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
card.flavor: Each victory adds a new verse.

card.name: Glory Seeker
card.flavor: The turning of the tide always begins with one soldier's decision to head back into the fray.

card.name: Gluttonous Zombie
card.ability: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.

card.name: Goblin Chariot
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

card.name: Goblin Glider
card.ability:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
card.flavor:
"What's got two arms, one wing, and no brains?"
—Ghitu riddle

card.name: Goblin King
card.ability: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
card.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

card.name: Goblin Raider
card.ability: Goblin Raider can't block.
card.flavor: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit and run.

card.name: Grave Pact
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control dies, each other player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Each other player sacrifices a creature for each creature you control that goes to a graveyard.

card.name: Gravedigger
card.ability: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Grizzly Bears
card.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

card.name: Guerrilla Tactics
card.ability:
Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If it is discarded, the damage done by it is done by this card due to an ability and not by a spell.
10/4/2004 : The second ability will trigger even on an optional discard caused by an opponent.
10/4/2004 : Discarding as a cost to cast a spell will not trigger the ability. Only discarding as an effect will trigger the ability.

card.name: Hammer of Bogardan
card.ability:
Hammer of Bogardan deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
{2}{R}{R}{R}: Return Hammer of Bogardan from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

card.name: Healing Salve
card.ability: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

card.name: Hibernation
card.ability: Return all green permanents to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: The deep sleep of winter is not always restful.

card.name: Hill Giant
card.flavor: Bent on a quest for blood, a giant can storm through a fort's wall as if it were nothing more than a picket fence.

card.name: Holy Day
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.flavor:
"The day of Spirits; my soul's calm retreat / Which none disturb"
—Henry Vaughan, "The Night"

card.name: Holy Strength
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

card.name: Honor Guard
card.ability: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"It is not a choice I make, to have this guard. It is the choice of my people, and my duty to them."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Horned Troll
card.ability: {G}: Regenerate Horned Troll.
card.flavor: Sword hilts jut from some trolls' bodies where wounds healed so fast that the weapons were trapped inside.

card.name: Horned Turtle
card.flavor: It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.

card.name: Howling Mine
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
card.flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
10/4/2004 : It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
10/4/2004 : The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
4/15/2013 : The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

card.name: Hulking Cyclops
card.ability: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
card.flavor: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.

card.name: Hunted Wumpus
card.ability: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.

card.name: Index
card.ability: Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
card.flavor: "Let's see . . . Mercadia, mercenary, merfolk . . . you know, I really need a better filing system."

card.name: Inferno
card.ability: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor:
"Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

card.name: Inspiration
card.ability: Target player draws two cards.
card.flavor: Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success.

card.name: Intrepid Hero
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
card.flavor: A fool knows no fear. A hero shows no fear.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The power of the creature is checked on activation and on resolution. If the targeted creature's power is not 4 or greater on resolution, the ability is countered.

card.name: Intruder Alarm
card.ability:
Creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, untap all creatures.
card.flavor: One footstep among many is silent. One footstep alone is deafening.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If multiple creatures enter the battlefield at one time, this ability triggers once for each creature. This doesn't matter much, but it can in some cases.

card.name: Invisibility
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by Walls.
card.flavor: Verick held his breath. Breathing wouldn't reveal his position, but it would force him to smell the goblins.

card.name: Iron Star
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Forged by a thousand flames.

card.name: Ivory Cup
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Blessed by a thousand prayers.

card.name: Ivory Mask
card.ability: You have shroud. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: Made from its wearer's hopes, the mask ensures that those hopes will be fulfilled.

card.name: Jayemdae Tome
card.ability: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Knowledge is power."
—Sir Francis Bacon, Meditationes Sacrae

card.name: Karma
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps he or she controls.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Amount of damage is determined when the ability resolves and not when it is placed on the stack.

card.name: Larceny
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
card.flavor:
Opportunity makes the thief.
—Roman proverb
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Triggers once per creature, not once per point of damage.

card.name: Lava Axe
card.ability: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
card.flavor: "Catch"

card.name: Lava Hounds
card.ability:
Haste
When Lava Hounds enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to you.

card.name: Lesser Gargadon
card.ability: Whenever Lesser Gargadon attacks or blocks, sacrifice a land.
card.flavor:
"In some cultures, elephants are ridden by those in power. I don't think a mere elephant would even be noticed in Keld."
—Onean sergeant

card.name: Lhurgoyf
card.ability: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
card.flavor:
"Ach Hans, run It's the lhurgoyf"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Lightning Blast
card.ability: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Those who fear the darkness have never seen what the light can do."
—Selenia, dark angel

card.name: Lightning Elemental
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"

card.name: Living Terrain
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a 5/6 green Treefolk creature that's still a land.
card.flavor: Some warriors walk the earth. Others are born of it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It does give the land a color and creature type, which is unlike most other ways to animate a land.
10/4/2004 : This can be placed on any land, not just Forests.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Llanowar Behemoth
card.ability: Tap an untapped creature you control: Llanowar Behemoth gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Most people can't build decent weapons out of stone or steel. Trust the elves to do it with only mud and vines."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : Since the activated ability doesn't have a tap symbol in its cost, you can tap a creature (including Llanowar Behemoth itself) that hasn't been under your control since your most recent turn began to pay the cost.

card.name: Lone Wolf
card.ability: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Looming Shade
card.ability: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.

card.name: Lord of the Undead
card.ability:
Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : Lord of the Undead now has the Zombie creature type and its first ability has been reworded to affect *other* Zombies. This means that if two Lord of the Undead are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

card.name: Lure
card.ability:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
card.flavor:
"When the forest wants something, no mortal mind can resist her."
—Maro
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Lure does not give a creature the ability to block the Lured creature, it just forces those creatures which are already able to block the Lured creature to do so.
10/4/2004 : If a Lured creature is in a band, only blockers able to block the Lured creature are affected by the Lure.
10/4/2004 : The opponent does not have to activate any abilities in an attempt to make his or her creatures block. More specifically, a cost to block of zero mana is an optional cost you can choose not to pay.

card.name: Maggot Carrier
card.ability: When Maggot Carrier enters the battlefield, each player loses 1 life.
card.flavor:
"We do not suddenly fall on death, but advance towards it by slight degrees; we die every day."
—Seneca, Epistles, trans. Gummere

card.name: Mahamoti Djinn
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

card.name: Mana Clash
card.ability: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Always affects the player and targets one of his or her opponents.
10/4/2004 : Each point of damage is dealt separately, so if you are damaged twice by this spell, each time is considered a separate time this source deals damage.
10/4/2004 : This card's coin flip has no winner or loser.

card.name: Mana Leak
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
card.flavor: The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.

card.name: Maro
card.ability: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
card.flavor: No two see the same Maro.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Creatures are only put into a graveyard for having 0 toughness when state-based actions are checked. If Maro's toughness goes to 0 during the announcement or resolution of a spell or ability and then goes back up above 0 before the end of that announcement or resolution, it won't be put into your graveyard when state-based actions are checked.

card.name: Master Decoy
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
card.flavor: A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again.

card.name: Master Healer
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: Her heart holds the pain of every soldier she's ever healed.

card.name: Megrim
card.ability: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
card.flavor: Memories cut from the mind can cut right back.

card.name: Merchant of Secrets
card.ability: When Merchant of Secrets enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: To scrape out a living in Aphetto, wizards are reduced to selling rumors, lies, forgeries, or—if they get desperate enough—the truth.

card.name: Merchant Scroll
card.ability: Search your library for a blue instant card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Lat-Nam wizards trade knowledge on scrolls made of magic so they can better guard against thieves and spies.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Might of Oaks
card.ability: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this"

card.name: Millstone
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
10/4/2004 : It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
10/4/2004 : Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

card.name: Mind Bend
card.ability: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
10/4/2004 : Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
10/4/2004 : It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
10/4/2004 : It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
10/4/2004 : You choose the words to change on resolution.
10/4/2004 : You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".
10/4/2004 : It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

card.name: Mind Rot
card.ability: Target player discards two cards.
card.flavor: What wizards fear most is losing their minds.

card.name: Mind Slash
card.ability: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: "I can't think with all that screaming."

card.name: Mind Sludge
card.ability: Target player discards a card for each Swamp you control.
card.flavor: When you get into the swamp, the swamp gets into you.

card.name: Mogg Sentry
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Tortured with magic by their masters, the moggs are enflamed by the smell of sorcery.

card.name: Monstrous Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Get in touch with your inner monster.

card.name: Moss Monster
card.flavor: After the battle, an eerie silence gripped the forest. The losers' remains were lightly dusted with green.

card.name: Murderous Betrayal
card.ability: {B}{B}, Pay half your life, rounded up: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: Which hurts more: a sword in the gut or a dagger in the back?

card.name: Nantuko Disciple
card.ability: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
Unanswered prayers are themselves answers.
—Nantuko teaching

card.name: Natural Affinity
card.ability: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
card.flavor: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Naturalize
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor:
"One touch of nature makes the whole world kin."
—William Shakespeare,
Troilus and Cressida

card.name: Nausea
card.ability: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : All creatures which are on the battlefield when it resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield later in the turn are not.

card.name: Nekrataal
card.ability:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Nothing happens if there are no non-artifact, non-black creatures on the battlefield when it enters the battlefield.

card.name: Nightmare
card.ability:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
card.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
10/1/2009 : Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.

card.name: Noble Purpose
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor: Fighting for the right reason is itself a source of strength.

card.name: Norwood Ranger
card.flavor: The song of the forest is in perfect harmony. If a single note is out of place, the elves will find its source.

card.name: Obliterate
card.ability:
Obliterate can't be countered.
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"The enemy has been destroyed, sir. So have the forest, the city, your palace, your dog . . ."
—Keldon soldier
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don't counter it since it can't be countered.

card.name: Ogre Taskmaster
card.ability: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
card.flavor: Ogres learn how to smash stuff even before they learn how to walk.

card.name: Okk
card.ability:
Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.

card.name: Oracle's Attendants
card.ability: {T}: All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn by a source of your choice is dealt to Oracle's Attendants instead.
card.flavor: The future isn't sacred, but its speaker is.

card.name: Orcish Artillery
card.ability: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
card.flavor:
"So they want to kill my men? Well two can play at that game."
—General Khurzog
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability is countered because the target is illegal.

card.name: Orcish Spy
card.ability: {T}: Look at the top three cards of target player's library.
card.flavor:
"You idiot Never let the spies mingle with the orcish regulars after completing a mission. Now we'll never get them to fight"
—General Khurzog

card.name: Pacifism
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
card.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

card.name: Panic Attack
card.ability: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
card.flavor: Sometimes everyone decides to go for help at the same time.

card.name: Patagia Golem
card.ability: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Its wings were only designed to be ornamental, but it learned to use them on its own.

card.name: Peach Garden Oath
card.ability: You gain 2 life for each creature you control.
card.flavor:
"We three, though of separate ancestry, join in brotherhood. . . . We dare not hope to be together always but hereby vow to die the selfsame day."
—Peach Garden Oath

card.name: Persecute
card.ability: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.
card.flavor:
"Of all the tyrannies on humane kind
The worst is that which persecutes the mind."
—John Dryden,
"The Hind and the Panther"
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The color is chosen on resolution.

card.name: Phantom Warrior
card.ability: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.
card.flavor: It can pass through solid matter—but that doesn't mean it's harmless.

card.name: Phyrexian Arena
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
card.flavor: A drop of humanity for a sea of power.

card.name: Phyrexian Colossus
card.ability:
Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

card.name: Phyrexian Hulk
card.flavor:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.
It doesn't laugh or cry.
All it does from dusk till dawn
Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme

card.name: Phyrexian Plaguelord
card.ability:
{T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Plaguelord: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The final stage of the illness: delirium, convulsions, and death."
—Phyrexian progress notes

card.name: Plague Beetle
card.ability: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
card.flavor: No one knows whether they were named for the disease they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.

card.name: Plague Wind
card.ability: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"The second wind of ascension is Reaver, slaying the unworthy."
—Keld Triumphant

card.name: Planar Portal
card.ability: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: These devices have been known to pull entire worlds through the Æther.

card.name: Plow Under
card.ability: Put two target lands on top of their owners' libraries.
card.flavor:
To renew the land, plow the land.
To destroy the land, do nothing.
—Druids' saying
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The owner decides the order the two lands are stacked there.

card.name: Primeval Force
card.ability: When Primeval Force enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice three Forests.
card.flavor: It has germinated in the earth for thousands of years. Finally it wakes to the battle's call.

card.name: Primeval Shambler
card.ability: {B}: Primeval Shambler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: His mind, like his body, is made up of the swamp's flotsam.

card.name: Puppeteer
card.ability: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
card.flavor: "Getting people to do what you want is merely a matter of telling them what they want to hear."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You decide on resolution whether or not to tap or untap the creature.

card.name: Pyroclasm
card.ability: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
card.flavor:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage

card.name: Pyrotechnics
card.ability: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
card.flavor:
"Who says lightning never strikes twice?"
—Storm shaman
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can assign damage to multiple targets and are not forced to assign the same amount of damage to each target.
10/4/2004 : You can't do fractional points of damage.
10/1/2008 : The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

card.name: Raging Goblin
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

card.name: Rain of Blades
card.ability: Rain of Blades deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
card.flavor: Some say they are the weapons of heroes fallen in battle, eager for one last chance at glory.

card.name: Raise Dead
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
10/4/2004 : The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Rampant Growth
card.ability: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Ravenous Rats
card.ability: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
card.flavor: Nothing is sacred to the rats. Everything is simply another meal.

card.name: Razorfoot Griffin
card.ability:
Flying
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

card.name: Redeem
card.ability: Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn to up to two target creatures.
card.flavor:
"Let me redeem my brothers both from death."
—William Shakespeare, Titus Andronicus

card.name: Reflexes
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor:
"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer

card.name: Regeneration
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.flavor:
"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid

card.name: Relentless Assault
card.ability: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
card.flavor: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
10/4/2004 : Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
10/4/2004 : A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
10/4/2004 : It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

card.name: Remove Soul
card.ability: Counter target creature spell.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Revive
card.ability: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Even what is lost beyond recall returns when coaxed by a dryad's hand.

card.name: Rewind
card.ability: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.
card.flavor: "Let's go over this one more time. . . ."
card.ruling:
7/1/2012 : Rewind targets only a spell. It doesn't target any lands. The lands are chosen on resolution. It doesn't matter who controls the lands.
7/1/2012 : When Rewind resolves, you choose up to four lands and those lands untap once. You can't choose one land and have it untap four times, for example.
7/1/2012 : If the spell is an illegal target when Rewind tries to resolve, perhaps because it was countered by another spell or ability, Rewind will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't untap any lands.
7/1/2012 : If Rewind resolves but the target spell can't be countered, you'll still untap lands.

card.name: Rhox
card.ability:
You may have Rhox assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Ridgeline Rager
card.ability: {R}: Ridgeline Rager gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: While armies battled across Jamuraa, beasts stalked the high places looking for victims.

card.name: Rod of Ruin
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.

card.name: Rolling Stones
card.ability: Wall creatures can attack as though they didn't have defender.
card.flavor:
"Trust me—the walls have more than just ears."
—Orcish spy

card.name: Royal Assassin
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
card.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can't target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.
10/4/2004 : If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin's ability resolves, then the ability is countered.

card.name: Rukh Egg
card.ability: When Rukh Egg dies, put a 4/4 red Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: Called "stonefeathers" by many lowlanders, rukhs are thought to descend from a phoenix that sacrificed its flame for a body of stone.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the Rukh Egg card is removed from the graveyard in the same turn it is put there, a Bird will still be put onto the battlefield.
10/1/2005 : If the Egg is exiled instead of being put into the graveyard, no Bird is put onto the battlefield.
10/1/2005 : Text-changing effects can be used to change the color of the Bird that will be put onto the battlefield.
10/1/2005 : If the Egg is destroyed while under the control of another player, the controller of the Egg gets the Bird.

card.name: Rushwood Dryad
card.ability: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
card.flavor: To a dryad, every tree in the forest is both a doorway and a window.

card.name: Sabretooth Tiger
card.ability: First strike
card.flavor: To a sabretooth, all men are mice.

card.name: Sacred Ground
card.ability: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.
card.flavor: The land will never betray those who gave their lives for it.

card.name: Sacred Nectar
card.ability: You gain 4 life.
card.flavor:
"Over the silver mountains,
Where spring the nectar fountains,
There will I kiss
The bowl of bliss;
And drink my everlasting fill. . . ."
—Sir Walter Raleigh, "The Pilgrimage"

card.name: Sage of Lat-Nam
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Draw a card.
card.flavor: Within each device is a spark of its creator's soul. Within each sage is a lamp that awaits that spark.

card.name: Sage Owl
card.ability:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

card.name: Salt Marsh
card.ability:
Salt Marsh enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
Only death breeds in stagnant water.
—Urborg saying

card.name: Samite Healer
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

card.name: Sanctimony
card.ability: Whenever an opponent taps a Mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: "The peasants labor for my profit. I approve."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Gaining life is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

card.name: Savannah Lions
card.flavor:
Even the brave are scared by a lion three times: first by its tracks, again by its roar, and one last time face to face.
—Somali proverb

card.name: Scathe Zombies
card.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

card.name: Sea Monster
card.ability: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
card.flavor: It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.

card.name: Searing Wind
card.ability: Searing Wind deals 10 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"The first wind of ascension is Forger, burning away impurity."
—Keld Triumphant

card.name: Seasoned Marshal
card.ability: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
card.flavor: She reads the battlefield like a map, always seeking the shortest route to victory.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can target an already tapped creature if you want.

card.name: Seismic Assault
card.ability: Discard a land card: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Earth arms itself with fire.

card.name: Serpent Warrior
card.ability: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
card.flavor: A hiss before dying.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

card.name: Serra Angel
card.ability:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
card.flavor: When she flies above the good, they consider themselves blessed. When she flies above the wicked, they consider themselves dead.

card.name: Sever Soul
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain life equal to its toughness.
card.flavor:
"The mortal world is a grove of sweet fruit, and I am ready to harvest it."
—Fallen angel

card.name: Severed Legion
card.ability: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: No one in Aphetto answers a knock at the door after sundown.

card.name: Shatter
card.ability: Destroy target artifact.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

card.name: Shifting Sky
card.ability:
As Shifting Sky enters the battlefield, choose a color.
All nonland permanents are the chosen color.
card.flavor:
Master the sky and you rule everything beneath it.
—Metathran saying

card.name: Shivan Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

card.name: Shivan Oasis
card.ability:
Shivan Oasis enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Only the hardiest explorers survive to eat the fruit.

card.name: Shock
card.ability: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"I love lightning It's my best invention since the rock."
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith

card.name: Shock Troops
card.ability: Sacrifice Shock Troops: Shock Troops deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: War is a conflict that determines not who is right—but who is left.

card.name: Sizzle
card.ability: Sizzle deals 3 damage to each opponent.
card.flavor:
"Of course you should fight fire with fire. You should fight everything with fire."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

card.name: Skull of Orm
card.ability: {5}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Though lifeless, the skull still possessed a strange power over the flow of magic.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can bring back any enchantment.

card.name: Slay
card.ability:
Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: The elves had the edge in guile, skill, and valor. But in the end, only sheer numbers mattered.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You don't draw a card if this spell is countered.

card.name: Sneaky Homunculus
card.ability: Sneaky Homunculus can't block or be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater.
card.flavor: Keep watch only for the giants and you'll be eaten by the ants.

card.name: Solidarity
card.ability: Creatures you control get +0/+5 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"We must all hang together, or assuredly we shall all hang separately."
—Benjamin Franklin

card.name: Soul Feast
card.ability: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
card.flavor: You are who you eat.

card.name: Spellbook
card.ability: You have no maximum hand size.
card.flavor: Knowledge knows no bounds.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Spellbook onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

card.name: Spiketail Hatchling
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Spiketail Hatchling: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
card.flavor: It dodges waves of water to prepare for waves of magic.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The spell's controller gets the option to pay when this ability resolves.

card.name: Spined Wurm
card.flavor:
"I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now that's a plan"
—Wandering mage

card.name: Spineless Thug
card.ability: Spineless Thug can't block.
card.flavor: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.

card.name: Spirit Link
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor: "I am bound to all my children. I share in their joys, I rage at their injuries."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Damage that is redirected is not dealt to the original creature or player, but it is dealt to the new creature or player.
10/4/2004 : You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.
4/1/2008 : You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

card.name: Spitting Spider
card.ability:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Sacrifice a land: Spitting Spider deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.

card.name: Spreading Algae
card.ability:
Enchant Swamp
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.
When Spreading Algae is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Spreading Algae to its owner's hand.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This card now has Enchant Swamp, which works exactly like any other Enchant ability. This means it can only be cast targeting a Swamp, and it will be put into its owner's graveyard if the permanent it's attached to ever stops being a Swamp.

card.name: Standing Troops
card.ability: Vigilance
card.flavor: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.

card.name: Star Compass
card.ability:
Star Compass enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a basic land you control could produce.
card.flavor: It doesn't point north. It points home.

card.name: Staunch Defenders
card.ability: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
card.flavor: The key to winning any fight is simply staying alive.

card.name: Steal Artifact
card.ability:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can be used on artifact creatures.

card.name: Stone Rain
card.ability: Destroy target land.

card.name: Storm Crow
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Storm crow descending, winter unending. Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

card.name: Story Circle
card.ability:
As Story Circle enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{W}: The next time a source of your choice of the chosen color would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

card.name: Stream of Life
card.ability: Target player gains X life.

card.name: Sudden Impact
card.ability: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
card.flavor: Most people know better. Goblins only know bigger.

card.name: Suntail Hawk
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Its eye the glaring sun, its cry the keening wind.

card.name: Sunweb
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Sunweb can't block creatures with power 2 or less.
card.flavor: Sometimes the wings of fallen dragons refuse to give up the sky.

card.name: Swarm of Rats
card.ability: Swarm of Rats's power is equal to the number of Rats you control.
card.flavor:
"Rats, rats, rats Hundreds, thousands, millions of them, and every one a life."
—Bram Stoker, Dracula

card.name: Sword Dancer
card.ability: {W}{W}: Target attacking creature gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Most soldiers think of the sword as a weapon. In the hands of Zho monks, swords are also the strongest of shields.

card.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You do your normal draw before this ability is put on the stack.
10/4/2004 : If you have more than one of these, each effect triggers separately.

card.name: Telepathy
