card.ability: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
card.flavor: "Secrets? What secrets?"

card.name: Temporal Adept
card.ability: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Of course she's at the head of her class. All of her classmates have disappeared."
—Tolarian renegade

card.name: Thieves' Auction
card.ability: Exile all nontoken permanents. Starting with you, each player chooses one of the exiled cards and puts it onto the battlefield tapped under his or her control. Repeat this process until all cards exiled this way have been chosen.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : In multi-player games, it affects all players and players make choices in turn order.
10/4/2004 : An Aura put onto the battlefield this way does not target the permanent it is placed upon.
10/4/2004 : Triggers from the permanents leaving the battlefield and then being put back onto the battlefield are not put on the stack until the entire effect is done.
10/4/2004 : You can't pick a card that can't legally be returned to the battlefield. If there are no cards that can be legally returned, then you can't pick one.
8/1/2005 : If you choose an Aura, you can put it on any permanent it can legally enchant. If there is nothing it can legally enchant, it remains exiled, and it can still be chosen by you or another player later in the auction. If there comes a point where only Auras and no legal permanents left, they stay exiled permanently.

card.name: Thieving Magpie
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
card.flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies steal jewels for theirs.

card.name: Thorn Elemental
card.ability: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.flavor: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Throne of Bone
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Tainted by a thousand fears.

card.name: Tidal Kraken
card.ability: Tidal Kraken is unblockable.
card.flavor: To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.

card.name: Trade Routes
card.ability:
{1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand.
{1}, Discard a land card: Draw a card.
card.flavor: The wise, the righteous, the mighty—the merchant feeds them all.

card.name: Trained Armodon
card.flavor: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

card.name: Treasure Trove
card.ability: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Wealth means power; the power to subdue, to crush, to exploit, the power to enslave, to outrage, to degrade."
—Emma Goldman, "Anarchism"

card.name: Tremor
card.ability: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
card.flavor: Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?

card.name: Tundra Wolves
card.ability: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor:
"I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains."
—Onean scout

card.name: Twiddle
card.ability: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.
10/4/2004 : The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.

card.name: Two-Headed Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{R}: Two-Headed Dragon gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Two-Headed Dragon can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
Two-Headed Dragon can block an additional creature.

card.name: Underworld Dreams
card.ability: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.
card.flavor:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If multiple cards are drawn at once, this card triggers once for each card drawn.
10/4/2004 : In a multi-player game, it affects all opponents.

card.name: Unholy Strength
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
card.flavor: Such power grows the body as it shrinks the soul.

card.name: Unsummon
card.ability: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

card.name: Urborg Volcano
card.ability:
Urborg Volcano enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Deep in the heart of Urborg lie massive volcanoes whose thick black smoke covers the land with perpetual darkness.

card.name: Urza's Armor
card.ability: If a source would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
card.flavor: Urza protected his body well, but neglected his soul.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect, and prevent the 1 damage to you only.
10/4/2004 : It is a prevention effect applied when damage would be dealt.

card.name: Urza's Mine
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

card.name: Urza's Power Plant
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

card.name: Urza's Tower
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.

card.name: Vampiric Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
When Vampiric Spirit enters the battlefield, you lose 4 life.

card.name: Venerable Monk
card.ability: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.

card.name: Verduran Enchantress
card.ability: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Graceful? Yes. Beautiful? Absolutely. Harmless? Definitely not."
—Fyndhorn elder
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : This does not trigger on the moving of an Aura from one permanent to another.

card.name: Vernal Bloom
card.ability: Whenever a Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
card.flavor: The sun breaks, the beasts stir, and the forest awakens to stand against its enemies.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is a triggered mana ability. It does not go on the stack.

card.name: Vexing Arcanix
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target player names a card, then reveals the top card of his or her library. If it's the named card, the player puts it into his or her hand. Otherwise, the player puts it into his or her graveyard and Vexing Arcanix deals 2 damage to him or her.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the player has no cards in their library, the effect does nothing. It does not cause any damage.
10/4/2004 : The target player names a card on resolution.

card.name: Viashino Sandstalker
card.ability:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
card.flavor:
"Some believe sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It is returned to its owner's hand at the end of any turn in which it is on the battlefield.

card.name: Vicious Hunger
card.ability: Vicious Hunger deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: Only the most ravenous soul feeds on the health of the weak.

card.name: Vine Trellis
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Nature twists knots stronger than any rope.

card.name: Volcanic Hammer
card.ability: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

card.name: Wall of Air
card.ability: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism

card.name: Wall of Spears
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
card.flavor:
"A stick is your friend. A pointed stick is your good friend. An army of pointed sticks is your best friend."
—Onean sergeant

card.name: Wall of Stone
card.ability: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
card.flavor: The ground itself lends its strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

card.name: Wall of Swords
card.ability: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: Sharper than wind, lighter than air.

card.name: Warped Devotion
card.ability: Whenever a permanent is returned to a player's hand, that player discards a card.
card.flavor:
"The spirit of the devout is easily crushed by the loss of hope."
—Fallen angel
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card can trigger on itself being returned to a player's hand.

card.name: Western Paladin
card.ability: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature.
card.flavor:
"Expect nothing but scorn, flattery, and lies. And never turn your back on him."
—Northern paladin

card.name: Wind Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
"But high she shoots through air and light,
Above all low delay,
Where nothing earthly bounds her flight,
Nor shadow dims her way."
—Thomas Moore, "Oh that I had Wings"

card.name: Wing Snare
card.ability: Destroy target creature with flying.
card.flavor:
"We are the hands of the great trees, reaching out to ensnare what threatens their branches."
—Elvish hunter

card.name: Wood Elves
card.ability: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Wooden Sphere
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Strengthened by a thousand limbs.

card.name: Worship
card.ability: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
card.flavor:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It reduces your life total to 1, not the damage to 1.
10/4/2004 : Worship does not prevent damage. It causes some damage to be unable to lower your life total. So any damage rendered useless by Worship was still dealt and is counted by effects that track the amount of damage done to a player. In addition, Worship does not prevent loss of life, so loss of life bypasses Worship.

card.name: Wrath of God
card.ability: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

card.name: Wrath of Marit Lage
card.ability:
When Wrath of Marit Lage enters the battlefield, tap all red creatures.
Red creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
card.flavor:
"Marit Lage lies frozen in a glacier's heart. Still her dreams take form in our world, stealing the heat from our souls."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

card.name: Yavimaya Enchantress
card.ability: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
card.flavor: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.

card.name: Zombify
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."
—Mystic elder

card.name: Zur's Weirding
card.ability:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
10/4/2004 : This is continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
10/4/2004 : If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.
4/1/2006 : When using Dredge with this, you have two choices.  You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur's Weirding's replacement.  If the latter, you first resolve Zur's Weirding's ability, then if you're going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.
